alert.note: Alert for Benton; Iowa; Johnson; Linn (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 07 at 5:02PM CDT until May 08 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM CDT FOR JOHNSON...SOUTHEASTERN BENTON...SOUTHERN LINN AND NORTHEASTERN IOWA COUNTIES... At 502 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Fairfax to near Oxford, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Cedar Rapids, Windham and F.W. Kent Park around 505 PM CDT. Swisher, Cosgrove and Cedar Rapids Municipal Airport around 510 PM CDT. Coralville, Tiffin, Shueyville and Cou Falls around 515 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include North Liberty, Ely, University Heights, Bertram, Oakdale, Twin View Heights, Sandy Beach Camp Ground, Iowa City, Solon, Hills, Lake Macbride State Park, Johnson County Fairgrounds, Iowa City Municipal Airport, University Of Iowa, Palisades-Kepler State Park, West Overlook, Coralville Lake Dam Complex, Mount Vernon, Lisbon, Hills Access, Elmira, Newport, Sutliff, Oasis and Morse. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: These storms are producing destructive winds and large damaging hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
